result.markdown:
---
title: "In-class Exercise 3: Kernel Density Estimation"
format: 
  html: 
    code-fold: true
    code-summary: "Show the code"
    code-overflow: wrap
    code-line-numbers: true
    code-copy: hover
execute: 
  eval: true
  echo: true
  freeze: auto
---


### Install `maptools`

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("maptools", repos = "https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/2023-10-13")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(maptools, sf, raster, spatstat, tidyverse)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
childcare_sf <- st_read("../../data/geospatial/ChildCareServices.geojson") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `ChildCareServices' from data source 
  `/Users/tangtang/Desktop/IS415 Geospatial Analytics and Applications/practice/is415gaa/data/geospatial/ChildCareServices.geojson' 
  using driver `GeoJSON'
Simple feature collection with 1925 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6878 ymin: 1.247759 xmax: 103.9897 ymax: 1.462134
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz_sf <- st_read(dsn = "../../data/geospatial",
                   layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `/Users/tangtang/Desktop/IS415 Geospatial Analytics and Applications/practice/is415gaa/data/geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```
:::
:::

## Create `CoastalOutline`

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(mpsz_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: plotting the first 9 out of 15 attributes; use max.plot = 15 to plot
all
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex03-KDE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

size of map is by default taking the entire `mpsz_sf` boundary -> appear small

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sg_sf <- mpsz_sf %>% 
  st_union()
plot(sg_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex03-KDE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Geospatial data wrangling

## Creating ppp objects (directly from sf)

Not necessary to convert into Spatial -> sp -> pp (Textbook chapter 4.5.1 to 4.5.3)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
childcare_ppp <- as.ppp(childcare_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in as.ppp.sf(childcare_sf): only first attribute column is used for
marks
```
:::
:::


Area unit not known -> package design


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(childcare_ppp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Marked planar point pattern:  1925 points
Average intensity 2.417323e-06 points per square unit

Coordinates are given to 3 decimal places
i.e. rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.001 units

marks are of type 'character'
Summary:
   Length     Class      Mode 
     1925 character character 

Window: rectangle = [11810.03, 45404.24] x [25596.33, 49300.88] units
                    (33590 x 23700 units)
Window area = 796335000 square units
```
:::
:::


## Handle duplicated data

Check for duplicated data point


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
any(duplicated(childcare_ppp))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::
:::


Count number of co-indicence point

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
multiplicity(childcare_ppp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

## Create `owin` object

Like above, one can directly convert `sf` into `owin` (No need to convert `sf` ->`sp` -> `owin`)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sg_owin <- as.owin(sg_sf)
plot(sg_owin)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex03-KDE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(sg_owin)
```

## Combine point event to owin object


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
childcareSG_ppp = childcare_ppp[sg_owin]
```
:::


## Extract planning area

with sf

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pg <- mpsz_sf %>% 
  filter(PLN_AREA_N == "PUNGGOL")
tm <- mpsz_sf %>% 
  filter(PLN_AREA_N=="TAMPINES")
ck <- mpsz_sf %>% 
  filter(PLN_AREA_N=="CHOA CHU KANG")
jw <- mpsz_sf %>% 
  filter(PLN_AREA_N=="JURONG WEST")
```
:::


Plot target planning area

-   `main` option gives the title for each subplot \(labelling purpose\)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(pg, main = "PUNGGOL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: plotting the first 9 out of 15 attributes; use max.plot = 15 to plot
all
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex03-KDE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(tm, main = "TAMPINES")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: plotting the first 9 out of 15 attributes; use max.plot = 15 to plot
all
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex03-KDE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(ck, main = "CHOA CHU KANG")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

all
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex03-KDE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(jw, main = "JURONG WEST")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: plotting the first 9 out of 15 attributes; use max.plot = 15 to plot

```
